content.description: Start on ledge and use shallow sidepull to stand up to slopey lip. Classic sloppy southern top out mantle
content.location: Right side of Soviet Cave by ep. 3

content.description: Same start as Hammer, but follows higher crack. Traverse right on small finger crack with good feet. Tops out on far right "teeth" ledge.
content.protection: Pads and spotters to move them

content.description: Same start as Hammer. Move up and left on flake ledge. Pop a heel until you can switch feet to the left. Continue traversing left and up to the large tan flake at the exit of the cave. Drop from here or down climb.
content.protection: Pads and spotters to shift pads
content.location: In the Soviet Cave. Same start as hammer.

content.description: Start at a low rail and move up to the left for two moves.  Once you reach the low ledge follow the crimps straight up the flat rock face.  Easy top out using the holds in the roof above you to pull onto the top of the ledge.  Problem can be made easier by starting in the corner using the lower ledge as starting holds, skipping the first two moves.
content.location: To the left of Soviet Cave and around the corner.  It is the north facing flat vertical wall covered in moss.

content.description: Start is far right, almost outside the Soviet Cave. Go straight up from flakes and crimps to a mantle top.

Same start as sickle. Start in very back of cave on chalked flake. Traverse right and up on obvious flake rail. Top out on far right, to the right of the large "teeth" flakes on the outside face of the cave. Same top out as "Our Warmup". A pumpy traverse problem.
content.protection: Two pads. Spotters to shuffle the pads
content.location: Located in the "Soviet Cave". Located near Ep. 3. From Ep. 3 walk NW along trail towards Ep. 4 for about 30 yards. After crossing the small bridge take the social trail up and right.

content.description:
Start on large chalked flake at back of cave. Work up to flake ledge on crimps and jugs. Follow loose crimps and flakes straight up and out to roof crack. End at lip and drop or do the sketchy top out through the V slot. 

 Open Project. Still being developed.
content.protection: Multiple pads and skilled spotters. Might be better as a hard trad line.
content.location: Deepest recesses of the Soviet Cave.

content.description: Start on two small stacked crimps in a small area in the back, right by the big rock on the ground. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pm7tmTamqhQHeres a video of the beta. Unfortunately i did not get the send on video, as it came unexpectedly but you can get a good idea of the beta.This whole cave is pretty choss though, all of these routes should not get anything more than 2 stars solely based on the poor rock quality. Any of these holds have the potential to break off pretty soon.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. Landing zone is right over a large rock with a small ledge.
content.location: Very back of the cave on the right side. The line starts to the left of a long thin crack. Should be obviously chalked but rain can change that.

content.description: Move up crimps and ledges to a flat ledge on the left side of the boulder. Mantle the overhung flat ledge to a chossy ledge.
content.location: Rock formation climber left and slightly back from the Soviet Cave.

content.description: Start on chalked crimps at about chest height. Move up to large flakes. Mantle top.
content.location: On right side of the Soviet Cave.

content.description: Start on lowest ledge and move up flat ledges with long reaches to a classic Southern Sloppy top.
content.location: On rock formation climber's left and slightly back from the Soviet Cave.

content.description: Start on ledge and move up and right to large teeth.
content.location: Right side of Soviet Cave. By ep. 3

content.description: Large cave above a swamp. Many traverses and routes with an opportunity for a long roof climb.
